Description: Juglet of Egyptian alabaster copying a Base Ring I pottery form; globular juglet with flat base and tall, narrow concave neck flaring to everted rim rim; strap handle from upper neck to shoulder;on the neck at the handle two circular ridges and ridge at base of neck; incised wavy lines on the lower part of the body; part of rim missing.
Bibliographic references: Malmgren 2003 / Klavdhia-Tremithos. A Middle and Late Cypriote Bronze Age site. (no. 165)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 4)
